title: Is 'Come up the stage' grammatically correct? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the scene you are trying to depict. Climb up the ladder is one such example without the “to” If the stage is something you “come” up then it is absolutely correct. For instance, if the stage was actually an incline, and you were simply moving from one end (near ground level) to the other end (higher up) than “Come up the stage” is correct. Otherwise, if you are merely telling someone to come here (to the stage), then it should be “Come up *to* the stage”
Preposition is missing. There should have been a ‘to’ in the phrase.
